post.body: - Well, please add me to your invitation list! I promise to wear my Sunday best and mind my manners. :)
- Oh, wow. That's coming up fast. I think you should have a virtual wine & cheese reception. Celebrations are always good to have.
- I can't wait to hear about your plans for 2009. Do you have an anticipated reveal date?
- How wonderful you have both. I think I need to start a list. Wish I had the organized brain that you do!
- How great you have new biz ideas for 2009. Different than what you've done in the past, or modifications of current ones?
- I don't have a dishwasher either - at least I have a birdhouse out the kitchen window over the sink. Washing meditation.
- Poignant article about Caroline Kennedy as America's Princess Leia. Thanks for tweeting. http://is.gd/cnNy
- I can so appreciate the stillness and quiet a blanket of snow brings when you can simply just be, and not have to go anywhere.
- Sweet dreams. Nice to hear that you loved "We Are Marshall" too.
What's something you're excited about for 2009?
I'm researching tribal and celtic tattoos for inspiration for a logo for a Christian church plant. You never know where the muse will lurk.
A joyous Christmas to all. My kids are grown, so now I'm up first, waiting for those sleepyheads to remember it's Christmas morning.
My daughter is busy cleaning and told me to relax. Good planning on my part to have a daughter who loves to organize & clean when visiting.
Please consider voting for my friend's son-in-law, Stephen Lynch, for Comedy Central's comedien of the year. http://tinyurl.com/83ptuy
Their house was saved due to the kindness of online strangers & a friend who blogs. http://tinyurl.com/9ez8kr
Cutting out soap labels I made for handmade soap Xmas gifts and pretending it's not 18 below w/wind chill. Holy cow, Mother Nature!
Just finished some design work. Do you think I should start wrapping Christmas presents soon? Or finish making them. Yikes.
Good morning Twittertown. It's 12 degrees outside. I'm grateful for a warm home, flannel nightgown and fuzzy slippers.
Many of us spent hrs getting church ready for our Christmas gathering tomorrow night. Bad blizzard coming-wonder if we'll even have church.
Just finished watching "We Are Marshall". Not holiday fare, but heartbreaking, touching and inspiring. I need a Kleenex.
